derivation.yuyuan_name: 1960s: from bio- 'human', on the pattern of electronic

entry.tran: （科幻小说或电影中部分器官被电子机械替代的）超人的
entry.def: In science fiction books or films, a bionic person is someone who has special powers, such as being exceptionally strong or having exceptionally good sight, because parts of their body have been replaced by electronic machinery.

means.word_mean: 2. having particular physiological functions augmented or replaced by electronic or electromechanical components
